result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs to allow defendant an opportunity to pay restitution order.
- As to mandatory costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: with credit for 96 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No contact with Devonta M. & Honora G.   ***Cases recalled. Appearances remain the same Court strikes the no contact with Devonta M. at Devonta M. request.
- If Honora G. wishes to have contact she can contact the PO agent.

supervisions.notes: - Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Court orders restitution in the amount of $48,890.79 awarded to the Wisconsin Support Trust Fund.  Cash bail on 14CF174 & 17CF1579 to apply.  Restitution to be paid first.
- ASSESSED ON CASE 17CF1579.

Defendant Elmo J Moore in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Elmo J Moore in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Sentencing hearing proceeded on all of defendant Elmo J Moore's cases 14CF174,17CF1579, 18CF449 and 20CF1156. State has complied with victim notification.  Statements made as to sentencing. Additional statements from:  Devonta M and Honora G

As to case 14CF174
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 28 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 96 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  

As to case 17CF1579
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 28 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 96 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 28 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to  Count 2), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  

As to case 18CF449
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 28 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 77 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  

As to case 20CF1156
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 7 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  

As to all cases:  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision: 
 
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- maintain work and/or school 
- 25 hours of community service
- no contact with Devonta M & Honora G   ***Cases recalled. Appearances remain the same Court strikes the no contact with Devonta M at Devonta M request.
  if Honora G  wishes to have contact she can contact the PO agent

Court orders restitution in the amount of $48,890.79 awarded to the Wisconsin Support Trust Fund.  Cash bail on 14CF174 & 17CF1579 to apply.  Restitution to be paid first.
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs to allow defendant an opportunity to pay restitution order.
As to mandatory costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Elmo J Moore in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Gilbert Fielding Urfer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. Court VACATES Jury Trial date. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defense requests adjournment for defendant to get affairs in order. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 18 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
